title: [app.mixmax.com] Stored XSS on Adding new enhancement.
vulnerability_information: Hi Mixmax team, Today I just found a Stored XSS on app.mixmax.com by adding a new enhancement. Just follow the steps below to reproduce this bug. **Vulnerable URL** [APP MIXMAX - Settings - Integrations & API](https://app.mixmax.com/dashboard/settings/integrations) **Payload** "> **Steps to reproduce** - Go to the [Vulnerable URL](https://app.mixmax.com/dashboard/settings/integrations). - Click Integrations & API then click Add Enhancement. - In the **Name Field** just add the **Payload** into it. add what ever you want in to the other fields then click **Add Enhancement** - after you add the new enhancement. the prompt will show like this: F191647 - and then we can share this New Enhancement to the other users or a team by clicking the share icon beside to our newly added enhancement. F191648 - add a user or a team to share this enhancement. F191655 - after you share this to the use users, the users will recieve an email regarding to the enhance that you have been shared to them. F191656 when the users or the the victim accept the enhancement, it will redirect to the **Vulnerable URL** and showing that our payload are working. XSSED! F191663 Regards, Sh3r1

activities.message: Thanks! Love to see the clear repro steps. Will fix!
@wearhere you are welcome, will waiting for your fix :)
This bug was tested and verified in Chrome Version 58.0.3029.110 (64-bit) and Mozilla firefox 53.0.3 (32-bit).
so many duplicates

Hi @wearhere for the additional concern. I would like to add compose.mixmax.com as a vulnerable URL. 

When you compose an email, your default and the  custom enhancements will be shown.  look at the image F192092 and F192091  for the poc. 

Thanks!
sh3r1
compose, signature,outbox,integrations and API,,branding, templates
Thanks @sh3r1 ! @whitesector I don't understand that comment—all the places that we've had XSS vulnerabilities?

Alright! thanks @wearhere.

We took a pause on HackerOne for a while and have made substantial changes to our platform since then. As such, we're closing out bugs as `Informative` and will accept new bug reports that are in accordance with our new disclosure policy and bounty ladder. Thanks!
